========================================================

- A program normally executes sequentially from top to bottom

- But some instructions can change the flow: *if* and *for* loops

Control flow 1/2
========================================================

- A program normally executes sequentially from top to bottom

- But some instructions can change the flow: *if* and *for* loops 

- **if** will test for a conditional comparison. Example
<br><span style="color: grey;">`$   string = "This string is long but not that long"`</span>
<br><span style="color: grey;">`$   if len(string) < 10:`</span>
<br><span style="color: grey;">`$   print("This string has at least 10 character")`</span>
<br><span style="color: grey;">`$   elif len(string) < 20:`</span>
<br><span style="color: grey;">`$   print("This string has at least 20 character")`</span>
<br><span style="color: grey;">`$   elif len(string) >30:`</span>
<br><span style="color: grey;">`$   print("That string is too long for me...")`</span>

```{python echo=FALSE}
string = "This string is long but not that long"

if len(string) < 10:
  print("This string has at least 10 character")
elif len(string) < 20:
  print("This string has at least 20 character")
elif len(string) >30:
  print("That string is too long for me...")
```
